intro: Sorbus tianschanica f. guttiformis, commonly known as the spotted whitebeam, is a rare and distinctive plant belonging to the Rosaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree characterized by its unique foliage, featuring leaves with prominent red or orange glandular dots. The plant is native to the Tianshan Mountains in Central Asia, where it thrives in rocky and alpine environments. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in clusters, and it produces edible berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
